boat.full_description:
Hyacinth was built in 1900 by Aldous of Brightlingsea, for the French family of Mersea. She was used for oyster dredging and remained in the family until the mid 1960s. She was then purchased by Clarke and Carters of Mersea, re-fitted and sold to Mrs. M. Kennell in 1969. Hyacinth was one of the few smacks to have never been un-rigged and although she had an engine installed in 1949, this was removed in 1970. She has had notable success in racing on the East Coast. In 1951 she won the Nova Trophy. She won the Tom Bolton Cup in 1971, 1972, 1976 and 1977.  She has been first boat home several times in OGA races.

Take a look at this archive video from British Movietone, undated but likely to be in the 1970s, showing her taking part in the annual Thames Oyster Smack Race from Gravesend to Billingsgate, won by 'Shamrock'.
